etymologies: late 18th century; earliest use found in William Taylor (1765–1836), reviewer and translator. From perfectible + -ist, originally after German Perfektibilist

definitions: A person who believes in the perfectibility of something, especially human nature; specifically a member of the Illuminati.

notes.text: The Order of the Illuminati founded by Adam Weishaupt in 1776 was previously known (amongst other names) as the Order of the Perfectibilists.
